In the meantime, I will continue to focus on key challenges facing Oklahomans every day like tackling rising health care costs and improving our education system.

The rule of law also requires the administration to release the whistleblower report. Our nation has laws to protect whistleblowers and to protect the security of our elections, both of which are fundamental to our democracy.

Americans are tired of finger pointing. We should do the job we were sent here to do.

I believe the testimony from the Director of National Intelligence on Thursday is essential to help us learn what happened and when.

It is time we find a bipartisan path to bring people together and get to the truth in an honest and methodical manner. To do that, we need all of the facts. This should be a detailed and responsible investigation and not one conducted in a media circus.

It is my job as a member of Congress to ensure our democracy stays strong. That means pursuing the truth and protecting ourselves from foreign adversaries. Our national security should never be partisan.
THREAD: When I was sworn into office, I took a sacred oath to protect and defend the Constitution of the United States. I take that responsibility very seriously.

Arbitration can be an option to solve disagreements without going to court, but everyone should get to choose.

If you’ve downloaded an app, signed up for a credit card, or signed an employment contract, you may have signed away your right to hold someone accountable. I don’t believe you can sign away your constitutional rights.

No one should have to sign away their right to go to court after experiencing sexual assault or discrimination, but that is exactly what forced arbitration clauses do. So, I voted for the #FAIRAct today to make these clauses illegal.
Arbitration can be an option to solve disagreements without going to court, but everyone should get to choose.

As the chair of the Space and Aeronautics Subcommittee, I am a proud cosponsor of the Hidden Figures Congressional Gold Medal Act! #HiddenFigures

Today H.R. 1396, the Hidden Figures Congressional Gold Medal Act, passed the House! This legislation ensures the brave women of @NASA are recognized for their integral contributions to the U.S. space program. #HiddenFigures

The Hidden Figures Congressional Gold Medal Act will award medals to Katherine Johnson, Dr. Christine Darden, Dorothy Vaughan, Mary Jackson, and one medal to honor the contributions of hundreds of other @NASA women who helped land the first man on the Moon. #HiddenFigures pic.twitter.com/wMVAD0T0V2

I am saddened to hear of the loss of OK civil rights and education leader, Thelma Parks. Parks taught in OKC’s first integrated school & went on to serve on the OKCPS school board for 22 years. Her legacy of service lives on through Thelma Parks Elementary, named in her honor.

This act authorizes $1B over 5 years for the Multifamily Housing Preservation and Revitalization (MPR) program for continued financing of loans for low-income & farm workers in rural areas. These loans support approximately 14k properties & 400k families across the country. (2/2)

Affordable and quality housing must be available to Oklahoma’s farm workers in rural areas; that’s why today I supported the passage of HR 3620 - the Strategy and Investment in Rural Housing Preservation Act. (1/2)
